intro: Wichuraea dulcis, commonly known as the sweet sarsapilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant's name reflects the sweet scent and flavor of its sap, which has been used traditionally in various remedies.
